results.title: Australia's north-west
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Donald Crombie and Oliver Howes
results.brief_description: Provides glimpses of the change taking place in the desert and sparsely settled cattle country of Australia’s north-west. The Ord River Irrigation scheme, new crops, new methods of cattle breeding, the iron ore mining boom, new towns, new people - all these contribute to the expansion of this little known corner of Australia.

results.title: Australia's new north-west. Pt. 2: The Pilbara-Hamersley region
results.brief_description: This program deals with the pastoral and timber industries in the Pilbara area, the development of iron ore mining at Mount Tom Price and the growth of towns and industries as a result. Narrated by Roger Climpson.

results.title: Australia's New North-West. Pt. 1: The Kimberley
results.brief_description: Part one of a two-part series, this film deals with agricultural and pastoral development in the Kimberley region. It illustrates the results of irrigation on pilot areas and also refers to the Flying Doctor Service, the School of the Air, and stock, crop and pasture improvement. Narrated by Roger Climpson.

results.title: Australia's New Faces 1969 Grand Final
results.creator_credit: GTV9 Melbourne, John Proper, Desmond Tester and Peter Faiman
results.brief_description: Out of 328 acts judged throughout 1969 are the 12 finalists. The winner will receive a $5,000 contract with the Nine Network. The winners - The Paul MacKay Sound; the judges - John Laws, Geoff Brook, Tom Miller, Pat London, Jim McKay. Hosted by Terry Dear and Frank Wilson, voice over by Pete Smith and sponsored by Kevin Dennis. Performing Contestants include Paul Mackay Sound and Mike McClellan.

results.title: Australia's lathes
results.brief_description: Observes how the Australian brand Macson Lathes is able to cut and manipulate metal producing metal products for other industries. Narrated by Ray Chapman.

results.title: Australia's journey: our first century as a nation (A)
results.creator_credit: ScreenSound Australia, Sally Jackson and Alec Morgan
results.brief_description: Commencing with Federation and the birth of a nation on 1 January 1901, this wonderful video captures the very essence of Australia and its people over 100 years, politically, socially, historically and environmentally. It manages to cover all aspects of Australian life from the city to the outback, from arts and entertainment to sport, from industry to technology, from the person on the street to the legends and heroes, from bushfires and droughts to floods and cyclones, from wars to peace, from civil rights protests to reconciliation. Through a compilation of archival film, television and newsreel footage the viewer is taken on a sentimental journey of historic events including WWI, WWII, 1956 Olympic Games, the railway linking of Australia’s east coast to the west coast, Royal visits, the birth of Canberra, along with glimpses of many famous faces such as Prime Ministers James Scullin, Billy Hughes, John Curtin, Gough Whitlam; sporting heroes Dawn Fraser, Sir Donald Bradman; actors and entertainers Errol Flynn, Lottie Lyall, Frank Thring Snr, Dame Edna, Mo, Ada and Elsie and much more. A most comprehensive and informative program. Contains b&w footage. Narrated by Amanda Keller.

results.title: Australia's inland sea
results.brief_description: This film received the Amateur Award in the 1951 Jubilee Film Competition. Three young Australians journeyed to Lake Eyre in the early 1950’s when the lake was filled with water from the highlands of Central Queensland.
